description: Borrowed from translingual Reduviidae, from Reduvius (genus name) +‎ -idae (taxonomic suffix), from Latin reduvia (“a remainder, remnant, fragment”), describing the habit of the nymph of Reduvius personatus camouflaging itself with small pieces of debris.

entries.meaning: (entomology) of, relating to, or characteristic of the family Reduviidae
(entomology) any member of the Reduviidae family of insects, which comprises predatory and blood-sucking bugs, including the vectors of Chagas disease
